intro: Tracheliopsis, commonly known as the starwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species that are typically annual or biennial herbs with slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are usually alternate and pinnately divided, giving the plant a delicate appearance. The flowers are often white or pale yellow and are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. These plants are often found in moist or disturbed soils and are sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
